Daily Bulletin - August 1st

01 August 2013

A roundup of news related to health, data, and design for August 1st 2013.

Articles & Links

  • UK plays catch-up with $380 million spend on cancer-zapping beams - Britain's state-run health service is to spend 250 million pounds ($382 million) on two proton beam cancer therapy centers, offering patients the opportunity to receive the modern treatment in London or Manchester from 2018.
  • Panel Urges Lung Cancer Screening For Millions Of Americans - NPR coverage of the Preventative Services Task Force's recommendation on lung cancer screening.
  • UCSD Center for Bioinformatic Analysis - Now searching for an Executive Director
  • How the government has spurred the adoption health care technology - Key sentence "Many of the benefits of EHRs have yet to be realized because of the lack of technical integration among various healthcare IT systems."
